title: Mark Wright says he was sad and lonely 'chasing money in LA' without Michelle Keegan
text:

Mark Wright has admitted he felt sad and lonely during his two year stint in Los Angeles.

The former TOWIE star moved stateside in 2017 to pursue his ambition of making it as an entertainment reporter.

But landing his 'dream job' at Extra came at a price for Mark who was forced to move away from his friends and family, including wife Michelle Keegan .

At the time both Mark and Michelle both vehemently denied their long-distance marriage was under strain.

(Image: WENN.com)

(Image: Getty Images Europe)

But speaking on his Heart radio show, Mark opened up for the first time about his own person struggle with the self-imposed separation.

Discussing a survey about whether money can buy happiness, Mark said, "60% of people say no - and I’m with them.

"Why am I with them? Kind of a personal experience if you don’t mind me sharing it." Mark explained: "Now of course if you have the important things in life, like on this list number one was laughter, number two was family and love, so if you have that and then you come in to money somehow, of course it’s going to make what you already have a little bit happier... but can it buy happiness that’s not there? No I don’t think I can," mused the former Towie star.

(Image: Splash News)

Bringing up his experience of living alone in America, Mark said: "I was fortunate enough to get an amazing job in Los Angeles, somewhere where I’ve always wanted to work, in Hollywood. I was living in the hills, Beverly Hills and the Hollywood Hills – life was great, so I thought."

Mark said that after four months into his new job his outlook began to change.

"Four, five months in, I sat back and I was a bit lonely, I wasn’t that happy, and obviously I went there to get a better job and to get more money as we say.

"And I was without my wife, who wasn’t living there 'coz she couldn’t and my family wasn’t there, my mum, my dad, my brothers and sisters, my friends.

"I can’t tell you how much I missed the normal things just sitting down the pub, the rain hitting the windows, the things we moaned about before I went and how lonely I felt and how sad I felt and that was all because I was chasing the money basically," Mark explained.

(Image: David M. Benett)

(Image: Daily Record)

The TV star said he felt very strongly about the subject and added: "There’s something to be said in just having security, having a roof above your head, with your family, with your loved ones."

He then advised listeners: "So if you’re with your loved ones right now, or your family, hold them close, get a takeaway in tonight, turn the heating on, cuddle up, winter’s coming – oh I love it, you cannot beat it."

(Image: Instagram)

Mark had moved to LA in 2017 after being hired as an entertainment reporter for network E!

He quit his job in January this year. Speaking at the time, Mark said he'd had an amazing time in the US but felt now was the time was right to move back to Blighty.

He told The Sun: "It just feels like the right time to come back to the UK and live here with my wife and family.

"I’ll always be grateful to the show Extra for the amazing opportunity they gave me."

(Image: Instagram)

After tying the knot in 2015, Mark and wife Michelle spent two years apart over their work commitments.

While Mark was in LA, Michelle also spent long stints abroad filming Our Girl.

"Wifi makes FaceTime free so we make it work," Mark said at the time.

Tune in to Mark Wright on Heart every Saturday from 4pm – 7pm
description: The former TOWIE star left family - including wife Michelle Keegan - behind to pursue his American dream
